newsitem.title: USA: Duff reaffirms CPC debt rating.
newsitem.headline: Duff reaffirms CPC debt rating.

text.p: Duff & Phelps Credit Rating Co said Monday it reaffirmed CPC International Inc's senior debt rating of single-A-plus and its commercial paper rating of D-One.
The rating affirmations cover CPC's total debt of about $2.9 billion. CPC is issuing $300 million in series E notes due December 15, 2026, Duff added.

"Our reaffirmation reflects CPC's strong and stable cash flow generated by its leading global consumer food businesses," Duff said. "The proceeds from the offering will be used to reduce short-term debt. Although credit protections are strong, they have declined slightly reflecting acquisitions and modest share repurchases."
However, credit protection mesures are expected to strengthen in the intermediate term, Duff added.
